title: Edited the Lol logo to better match Riot's current business practices

replies.body: Sorry to be that guy, but Riot's nowhere near what EA is doing when it comes to micro-transactions. You can still play league of legends without paying a cent the entire time. Yes, the new Blue Essence needs some work, but I will point out the obvious fact: it is still preseason. Riot is still tweaking things in preparation for Season 8, so just wait a month or so, and Riot will probably fix the system to something more tolerable.

Alterations to do with the store should've been 
completed and fully tested before the changes were applied, the fact it was approved to be unveiled to the public in this state is bad business practice. Gameplay issues to do with preseason balance is understandable. Store issues is not as it has nothing to do with the balance team. 

EA games (apart from the initial payment obviously) can be played without paying a single cent. How they work is that they use manipulative ways to get unaware people to spend money. Looking at you Dead Space 3.

Riot's loot box system is manipulative, locking away champion skins and encouraging kids to pile drive their way through their parents money as they don't know any better. Meanwhile their parents probs don't even realise what's going on until they see a huge credit charge on their bank statement.

Then there is the questionable matter of emotes as they mainly can only be obtained through real money. Which isn't bad at first until you realise people can mute them, this leads to potential problems as someone who pays an emote gets excited, can't wait to use and show it off in game but realises no one can see it as it Might be muted by everyone. Inherently making them feel like their money is wasted.

There's also the known debates on how they handle skins. 

I'm just tired of waiting for Riot to fix a never ending stream of issues they keep creating. Give them an inch they take a mile, season 7 was a joke with how they handled it. It's a joke in general how long it takes them to do anything. 

Are they as bad as EA? No. Can they be compared to EA based on their shenanigans? Yes.

Your arguments are very skewed and biased. Skins are a way to keep the game profitable, if skins didn't exist League would be either non-existent or P2P. As for loot boxes, there are good arguments on both sides. True, it is manipulative to include a form of gambling into the game. On the other hand, boxes provide free content that is usually behind a paywall and I personally have never felt the urge to buy loot boxes, it always felt like a bonus for spending time on the game. 

Your point about emotes is slightly odd to me. Yes, emotes can be blocked by enemies. But the player themselves can still see them. And the vast majority of players can see them. It's just a way to avoid people who have binds that make their emote show up every time they use their Q. It's annoying and I think it's a good thing Riot has a way of avoiding it. 

Also curious to what debates there are. Skins don't inherently give advantages to the player (excluding some skins with favourable particles such as iBlitz).

https://media.giphy.com/media/1Z02vuppxP1Pa/giphy.gif

Getting so sick and tired of people who make this bullshit argument as if Riot owes them free/cheap skins. Also, based on my current experience and the math set forth by a rioter on another post, I am inclined to believe that the BE system is at least as good as the old IP system, but with the added bonus of not having to buy runes. So I really don't get why people are complaining about this, especially when games are being decided at around the 5 to 10 minute mark with no real opportunity for a comeback.

Getting so sick and tired of people who blindly believe in some ass pulled "math" rather than check it for themselves, only because "Rito said so, so it must be true".

http://78.media.tumblr.com/aec344547d80de8bc05b17af6e97729b/tumblr_mlgzuvRnTL1s46koto5_500.gif

Also based on my current experience after 6 level ups I got 15-20% less BE than I'd get IP even before that IP increase bug of the last patch before the preseason.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/13HL0sRxqPHTVcE-cGSYHNR4ursTeHzCrXqDMK6Pupdc/edit#gid=1182281366
That document maintains what Riot has been saying about most people having similar or more BE gain, and only extraneous players who play tons every day are earning less.

And all I have to do to prove it wrong is to use this equation:

_[Number of FWotD between level ups]_ \* 150 IP + _[Number of games played between level ups]_ \* 67 IP _(for 50% winrate with average length of matches)_

Then compare it to the amount of BE I got in the same amount of games.

The result is that I'm, as mentioned before, 15-20% behind while playing merely 3-4 games a day.
Not 10 or 20.
3-4 matches.

>Then compare it to the amount of BE_** I **_got in the same amount of games.

Yes, compare it to what **_YOU_** got, not to the international average of what EVERYONE got. I love how people think that they, as individuals, are statistically significant. Please take a class.

Except the average is STILL lower.

Go on and do calculations yourself.

IP gains and XP gains were and still are dependant entirely on length of a match and whenever the match was a win or a loss.

Pick an average game length and assume 50% win ratio.

It isn't rocket science to put 2 and 2 together, it's grade school arithmetics.

You have tabulated data on every single League player IN THE WORLD to come to this conclusion, have you? Oh, you haven't. Oh, so you are considering a singular datum as representative of the whole. Please go look up the term "statistically significant". I'll wait.

At first it sounds smart, but when I read it again I questioned what it has to do with my previous comment.

I can, however, use this against you.

How could've Riot tabulated data on every single League player IN THE WORLD to come to the conclusion that an "average player" will earn more BE than they did IP if they play less than 10 games a day on the first day after the change?

They don't have to tabulate every single player. They have. All. The. Numbers.

They decided how much XP you earn and how much was required to level up. They decided what the shard drop rates and values for capsules would be and exactly how they would be weighted. They know exactly what the average game length is. They know what the distribution of games played per day among all players looks like. There isn't a single piece of information they didn't consider when drawing up the numbers for the new system.

All that math that you don't quite grasp from that document you linked? Riot did that when they very first decided on what the new leveling system would look like. On top of that, they know how many players play a little, how many play a lot, and everything in between, and how much players would be earning at every point on that distribution. They then had full control to tweak the numbers to achieve a BE earning rate that they decided on, which ended up being earning slightly more unless you're a player who plays significantly more games per day than the average.

Riot was transparent about the leveling and BE changes. Players checked Riot's math to see if they were lying. The result is that document, which confirms what Riot has been saying about the new BE earning rates. Everything is working exactly as intended. You not getting as much BE as you think you should does not change that.

My argument is biased yes, I feel annoyed at riot. I'm not hiding that fact. The statement I made is my own opinion and to show  how I feel. I hate loot boxes in general no matter what game they're from. 

I know skins are a way to maintain to money I never said they were bad, In fact my biggest enjoyment playing league was when it was just. They make skin, I like skin, I buy skin. No loot box shenanigans.

The point I wanted to make with emotes was that because they can be potentially ignored by the everyone else in the game. They should atleast have them cost blue essence as well due to the fact that they could be muted is what I'm trying to state.

The issues with skins are how they're handled mainly, Cassiopeia players for instance had to wait 4 years to get a skin. I could've got a uni degree to learn how to make a skin myself by that time. Issues like that is what makes champion player bases feel isolated. 

Some other issues are how the meta can be altered to buff champs that are receiving an upcoming skin. This isn't a problem itself but when must needed champion nerfs are being delayed until after a skin is released it becomes a problem. Creating issues for player enjoyment when facing against said champ is much longer than what is nessecary. Then also people who buy the skin end up feeling bamboozled as well because they're champ got hit hard with the nerf bat straight afterwards. This doesn't happen all the time (comparing project Ashe to pulsefire cait release) but the fact that it does is the issue.

> In fact my biggest enjoyment playing league was when it was just. They make skin, I like skin, I buy skin. No loot box shenanigans.

Is there anyone preventing you from doing that now (aside from the gemstone skins)?

Eh, maybe before the recent Star Wars Battlefront and their most recent racing game. Those games are hinged entirely on microtransactions and basically required you to use them. Alternatively you could pay a ridiculous amount of money and get ahead. League of Legends, for all the debate on their lootbox system or skins is completely free. You cannot pay real money to get a permanent item that makes you better than everyone else. If you really felt that way, you could compare them to older EA. I don't believe they are, but everyone has opinions. However recent EA has become an even worse company, worse than pretty much any other one currently working in the games industry.

It takes longer to unlock everything in League than it would in Battlefront II before the changes were put on hold, and it would also cost ***SIGNIFICANTLY*** more to purchase everything in League of Legends than the $2,100 it would have in Battelfront.  Even adding the price of the game itself in doesn't come close to how expensive League would be to unlock everything.

They even made their boxes that you can buy worth less than just straight up buying what you want from the store, on top of having it be RNG, and sometimes even giving you only champ shards, which are now almost entirely worthless-- especially for spending real money on. 

So. . . how are they so different again?  They even blatantly lied to their player-base multiple times, including about the BE changes, actively attempted to stiffle any information about the OE changes before nerfing the value of things ***people actually paid for, without properly notifying them that this would happen, and then did not offer refunds of any sort*** so don't even start with any bullshit about RIOT now being shady-ass, greedy-ass motherfuckers.
Free game vs not a free game. One is obviously going to include micro-transactions in order to survive. Figure out the rest yourself.

also skins don't offer a statistical advantage over other players and are not required to be competitive. With Runes being free now there isn't even an incentive to jam a million games to get the rune page you want.
It'd be great if this was true, but there are quite a few skins with particles and models that are misleading.

> [{quoted}](name=Brisingr25,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=zXxzTFug,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2017-11-28T03:58:06.511+0000)
>
> Sorry to be that guy, but Riot's nowhere near what EA is doing when it comes to micro-transactions. You can still play league of legends without paying a cent the entire time. Yes, the new Blue Essence needs some work, but I will point out the obvious fact: it is still preseason. Riot is still tweaking things in preparation for Season 8, so just wait a month or so, and Riot will probably fix the system to something more tolerable.

The problem isn't "they're suddenly EA levels of bad" it's that money is becoming the main focus more and more on their decisions, **and it's starting to effect the games quality and annoy the playerbase**.

Why aren't we getting full rune refunds like promised? "Because money."
Why is the loot and currency being changed? "Because money."
Price tags are being put on quests, a system that was originally suppose to be a fun reward system for it's dedicated players.
Price tags were attempted to be put on skin borders.
Emotes have been turned into a money thing (while being advertised as a communication tool, which frankly... is bad)
And that's just to name a few.

And the biggest slap to the face is that the games balance, **even before preseason** has had major glaring issues that just aren't getting fixed in a timely manner if at all and in my opinion some of these preseason changes just feel so rushed or at least not thought out. So why do they feel justified to ask for MORE money?
People like you are the reason they put loot boxes in games and the reason people have gambling problems.

> [{quoted}](name=Brisingr25,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=zXxzTFug,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2017-11-28T03:58:06.511+0000)
>
> Sorry to be that guy, but Riot's nowhere near what EA is doing when it comes to micro-transactions. You can still play league of legends without paying a cent the entire time. Yes, the new Blue Essence needs some work, but I will point out the obvious fact: it is still preseason. Riot is still tweaking things in preparation for Season 8, so just wait a month or so, and Riot will probably fix the system to something more tolerable.

my thoughts exactly, league is balanced and not pay to win. people go from bronze to diamond all the time with literally ANY champ or all of the champs. EA and pretty much every console company and game is trash. the players are honestly dumb as shit for even worrying about battlefront 2. the game will be forgotten and obsolete by this time next year. the games reviews are 3.5 stars out of 5 on two top google sites when u search it. people don't even mind that they pay 60$ for a piece of trash that costs even more money because its pay to win. while league is 100% free and better quality. I played the old battlefront 2 on PC but the console companies are all a joke now and so are their players leaving the game positive star reviews while complaining everywhere else online.   

Edit: I couldn't give any less shits about blue essence, never had anything to spend ip on and now I have pretty much nothing to spend blue essence on so why would I care about how fast I get a useless currency. once you own all the champs the shit is 100% useless as far as gameplay is concerned, especially now that there are no runes or rune pages.

This is turning into an over-exaggerated witch hunt at this point.  In EA's case they are price gouging people for what they have to pay for. In leagues case its just people complaining that they cant get free stuff as fast as they used to.

The case with EA, is that they tied the progression in-game with randomnes, and tied the randomness to a wait game, in order to cash in on the impatience of players who would not want to play for days just to receive a single prize. It works, because it constantly places the prize in front of your eyes, but out of reach of your hands, making said impatience build up
Riot is doing the same, but without the progression. Certainly, you can just buy most things you want, but the human brain reacts more to a reward that's unexpected than to an expected one, and therefore a skin you would not buy directly becomes more enticing if given out due to a random shard piece. Then comes into play the "can't get free stuff as fast as they used to" you mention, because that is the point in which they cash in on the impatience of players, and those who received a high enough stimulus from their random prize and want to obtain it, but lack the OE to do so... welll, don't you think they might strongly consider purchasing a hextech box now, even if they never thought about doing it before? And maybe find something else they might also want in the process? That's the whole point of this system, to incentive additional purchases, and was placed in motion not because Riot wants to reward players from the bottom of their heart, but because it works on it's intended purpose.
Certianly, Riot does not have monetary entry barrier, and the system does not direcly improve game performance, so most people will give it a pass actually buy their excuse of it beign a reward system to players. After all, those who are not affected, those who do not receive this stimulus from unexpected rewards will feel completely safe from this as they're not even affected indirectly from a progression perspective. But for those who do, this is not an innofensive system at all, and is as "predatory" (as it is fashionable to say, now) as what EA intended with their lootboxes.

Sounds like using the honey pot method to me. Dangling something you want in front of you, but which you are unable to reach.

Psychologically speaking, that is unfortunately a very effective method.
_Especially_ to those already prone to gambling.

They also lied to their players, and nerfed OE, which people actually did pay for, and then devalued their boxes, which people actually do pay for.  They're doing the same shit, and all they seem to care about-- and their bloody justifications for half these new changes-- is literally just money.

>just money

That thing that they produce in abundance, making it possible for the game to be f2p.  You can choose not to spend on this game without missing out on any gameplay, not even having to grind (assuming you own the champions you actually care about).

Compared to most other games, League is extremely generous.

See, the problem isn't what you get for free - the issue is what you get when you pay for it.

I recently bought the 10+1 Hextech chest bundle.
...And got 4 champions from them. 

I already own every champion, so what am I supposed to do with more BE? I can get that for free from the level-up chests.
As others are suggesting too: Leave champions out of the purchased chests.
And now, when you buy chests and get skin shards in them, they are devalued to pretty much nothing.

But we don't compare league to only just other games. We compare them to Dota2 and Heroes of the Storm, top 2 competitors. Dota2 you don't have to worry, all champions are free from start, while game is being top quality, top balance and more strategic and interesting, more time will be consumed there and for a good reason.

While Heroes of the Storm champion unlocking isn't THAT hard and they give enormous legendary awards for being veteran player and game supporter. Don't know much about game quality there, but players who go there ain't coming back to here, that much i hear.

Riots best move would be to put champion acquiring even easier, but they did the opposite. Riots best move would be also to reward their veteran players, not secretly deflate all the currency value game has, also rune changes, people had up 20 mastery pages and less rune pages, since many rune pages were universal. Now we have only runes but pages are only as much as you ever had, meaning that most people will end up now buying 10 and more rune pages because it will become necessity as you want to play other champions, roles, modes and so on.  For me to buy necessary rune pages i will be in - 20000 BE than they ever gave me back for ''big veteran award''. Yeah also Riots best move would be to actually care for veteran players and award them. 

I was with 1 leg out since past seasons they been nerfing classic mages, and not even fixing their game breaking bugs EVER, some champions still have bugs from their release. This is how they threat their most loyal supporters.

Honestly, are people really in shock that someone compares this to EA ? Judging by upvotes - no. Obviously guy over exaggerated, but i think there is better moba games out there, its just hard for most loyal fans to just switch after 7 years of playing LoL and endless skin buying. We would rather stay here.

> [{quoted}](name=NovemCaudaVulpis,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=zXxzTFug,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2017-11-28T08:51:05.024+0000)
>
> This is turning into an over-exaggerated witch hunt at this point.  In EA's case they are price gouging people for what they have to pay for. In leagues case its just people complaining that they cant get free stuff as fast as they used to.

Nah, not at all.  I don't mind not getting free stuff, I don't mind having to work more and put more time into the game to earn stuff.

I mind getting nickle and dimed, and I mind normal progression having an artificial feeling of paywalling on it.  God knows getting the roster will be nigh impossible now, shit, I'm just trying to get the last 15ish champs I need and all I can do is sigh knowing that it won't be happening without either spending money for champs, which I detest...or frankly I can't see actually earning them through the new bullshit BE system...so...yeah.

I mean I'll complain about OE getting nerfed till the cow comes home because that was a product I would purchase (and get a random value for my purchase).

Yes, I was a buyer of those damn loot boxes and even though they were kind of shitty, I did enjoy them. Now, I am getting less value for what I pay and I already pay more for RP to begin with. I don't know why I would ever buy these boxes now, something I was fine buying before, when a large chunk of the value has been striped from these boxes. It feels really cheap and short handed to me.

This again? 
_:rolls eyes:_

If Riot mimicked EA's marketing, every patch update would be labeled as an "expansion pack" and would cost money.

Every 5 or 6 years we would get a new installment of League. _"League of Legends 2"_, _"League of Legends 3"_, and so on. All of which will be pay-to-play.

Not to mention that all the champions will be RP only.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}} 

Luckly, Riot does none of those things.
So, please, do not compare them to EA.

http://www.auplod.com/u/dpoula9d885.png
Now just change riots fist logo to a middle finger.
https://i.imgur.com/AgbSRMz.jpg
Except you don't get any gameplay advantage from boxes on league.
Well, you _do_ get a minor one. Not _much_ of one, but you still get one. Having more champions _is_ advantageous.
I don't agree with you on that, but good meme anyway.
As someone who knows the essence reduction rates are actually bullshit, it's still better than the absolute 0 + 1 victorious skin a year we **used** to have.
logged in just to upvote this.  Too perfect right now

Here's what I've got to say:

Of course Riot aren't nowhere near **EA** at this point. The worrying part is that **EA**'s nasty name is popping in the conversation at all. That should be telling enough about how people feel about Riot's recent practices.
I don't agree but that's hilarious
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}} {{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}

Chuckled, shared, GF and roomie asked why I chuckled..."Holy shit it's not just you saying it! SEND IT TO ME!" And shared from them.

Glorious.

This is top quality work sir, upvoted and appreciated for honesty.  One day Riot will actually see where we're coming from...unfortunately it might be when league is an 'eSport only' game since the masses will tell them to shove it.

They better hope no one makes a contender, it could hurt them bad right now.
yes.{{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}

lmao.

Priceless
Its not as bad but the trend is tilting towards it
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
I do love me a quality shitpost {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
spicy
Once League costs $60 to play initially, I can agree with this non-jokingly.
